channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: My three words Walnuts, cuddle,reflect, 10th February
item.description:
There is a line of deep potholes that traffic can't avoid because of the narrow road and the cars parked on the opposite side, they are getting deeper by the day, are filled with water and are going to damage a lot of cars

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The repaired sink hole is failing again, 10th February
item.description:
The sinkhole previously filled in is dropping again. There are also another two which are forming. If a large vehicle comes along they hit this and shake my entire property at 40 Malleson Road causing cracking to my front walls.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Underground drainage is blocked and water is spurting up through the carriage way., 10th February
item.description:
The water is raising the cartage way and causing the surface to breakup badly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cleeve Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The side of the carriageway has fallen away, 10th February
item.description:
The side of the carriageway is badly eroded with large holes causing small vehicles to have to swerve into the path of oncoming traffic to avoid. Also large vehicles are adversely effected by the camber change. Very dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cleeve Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fair of the road around the drainage gully, 10th February
item.description:
A large hole has formed at the side of the gully on the inside of this very tight, unlit bend
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cleeve Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is not a blocked gully, it is a blocked drain issue, 10th February
item.description:
The drainage system is blocked in Manor Lane as it joins Gretton Road forcing the water to exit the system at this point and flood down the road drenching parents and children going to school. Before it flows past the blockage and can reenter the drainage system.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is not a blocked gully issue., 10th February
item.description:
The drainage system in Manor lane is blocked so water is forced to flow out of the underground system over the road and is causing measurable damage. At this point the water is flowing out of the manhole cover just off the carriageway, it flows down Manor Lane to the second gully where it can then reenter the drainage system.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Water is flowing up from this gully as the system must be blocked between gullies causing flowing water down Malleson Road, 10th February
item.description:
The drainage system from 58 Malleson down to 68 is blocked underground and the water can not flow through it so is forced to flow over ground.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Water meter cover has hardened tarmac on, 10th February
item.description:
I have reported this before and nothing happened. I am getting regular messages off the water company as they can't access the cover as the material is blocking the key holes. This was reported last year and i believe its a year since the pedestrian area was recovered.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73-75, High Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Sunken road surface, 10th February
item.description:
A40: Junction of Andover Road and Lypiatt Drive My house is 30 yards east of the hole and extra heavy vehicles cause the house and terrace to shudder, causing disturbance to sleep at night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lypiatt Drive, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
